snippet: Beijing and Shanghai announced they would put in place new restrictions and penalties on housing sales to ensure that prices do not continue to soar, fueling what many say is a real estate bubble.
abstract: Beijing and Shanghai announce they will put in place new restrictions and penalties on housing sales to ensure that prices do not continue to soar, fueling what many say is a real estate bubble; property prices in China have been rising sharply, with prices in big cities up average 3.1 percent in Feb 2013.
lead_paragraph: Beijing and Shanghai announced they would put in place new restrictions and penalties on housing sales to ensure that prices do not continue to soar, fueling what many say is a real estate bubble.

headline.seo: 2 China Cities Move to Cool Overheated Housing Market
headline.main: 2 Chinese Cities Move to Cool Overheated Housing Market
headline.print_headline: 2 Chinese Cities Move to Cool Overheated Housing Market
